H0.text: Convection in the atmosphere causes a change in air density, resulting in winds, is the most likely result of the Sun heating Earth's atmosphere unevenly.

H1.text: Conduction through the atmosphere causes evaporation to occur over oceans, resulting in rain is the most likely outcome when the Sun heats Earth's atmosphere unevenly.

H2.text: Radiation from the Sun will reflect through the atmosphere back into space resulting in cooler evenings is the most likely result of the Sun heating Earth's atmosphere unevenly.

H3.text: Radiation from the Sun will cause atmospheric moisture to collect over mountain ranges, resulting in snowfall, as the most likely result of uneven heating of Earth's atmosphere.

A4.text: This expansion contributes to increased winds, cumulus cloud development, and decreased surface dew points (the temperature below which condensation occurs).
